data.title: The Formation of The Kingdom of Asturias
data.meta_description: G y H (1) - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Alfonso I and Alfonso II were early monarchs of the newly formed Kingdom of Asturias in northern Spain, after Pelagius defeated the Muslims at Covadonga in 722. Alfonso II established Oviedo as the capital and reinstated some Visigothic laws. The Marca Hispanica region of northeastern Spain, governed by Charlemagne, became independent counties after his death, including the Kingdom of Pamplona and the Aragonese and Catalan counties.
data.text: The Formation of The Kingdom of Asturias
